beaches.name: Cala Capitán
beaches.description: Stunning rocky cove with crystal-clear water, rock pools, and excellent snorkeling

beaches.name: Cala Caleta
beaches.description: Smaller cove with natural beauty, quieter atmosphere

beaches.name: Playa de La Zenia
beaches.description: Wide sandy beach just north, full facilities

shopping.name: La Zenia Boulevard
shopping.description: Europe's largest open-air shopping center, 150+ stores

shopping.name: Cabo Roig Strip
shopping.description: Traditional shops, restaurants, and the famous Saturday market

golf.intro: Cabo Roig sits at the gateway to Orihuela Costa's golf triangle. While the harbor and beaches are the main draw, world-class golf is just minutes away. The area attracts golfers seeking Mediterranean character alongside their fairways.

courses.name: Villamartin Golf
courses.description: Championship course since 1972. Hosted European Tour events. The heart of expat golfing.

courses.name: Las Ramblas Golf
courses.description: Dramatic course with elevation changes and Mediterranean views.

courses.name: Campoamor Golf
courses.description: Nearest course to Cabo Roig. Well-maintained and suitable for all levels.

courses.name: Las Colinas Golf
courses.description: Award-winning course ranked among Spain's best. Premium experience.

saturdayMarket.name: Cabo Roig Saturday Market
saturdayMarket.description: One of the best markets on the coast. Fresh produce, fish, flowers, clothing, crafts, and bargains. Locals and tourists alike flock here.

content.metaTitle: Bo i Cabo Roig 2026 | Nybyggda hem på Costa Blanca
content.metaDescription: Complete guide to Cabo Roig—charming harbor, rocky coves, famous Saturday market. Properties from €210k. Traditional Mediterranean character on Costa Blanca South.
content.quickAnswer: Cabo Roig is Costa Blanca South's most characterful coastal village, with a charming harbor, crystal-clear rocky coves (Cala Capitán), and the famous Saturday market. Properties start at €210,000 for apartments, €280,000 for townhouses, and €450,000 for villas. It's 5-12 minutes from 4 championship golf courses.
content.heroIntro:
If you've ever dreamed of the authentic Mediterranean—fishing boats bobbing in a small harbor, crystal-clear coves carved into the coastline, fresh seafood served as the sun sets over the sea—Cabo Roig is where that dream becomes reality.

This small coastal enclave on Orihuela Costa has somehow preserved its character despite the development that transformed neighboring areas. The harbor remains the heart of the community, its restaurants famous across the region for grilled fish and paella with a view. The Saturday market draws visitors from miles around, its stalls spilling through the streets with fresh produce, flowers, clothing, and treasures. And the beaches—rocky coves with water so clear you can see the bottom from ten meters—offer something different from the wide sandy stretches elsewhere.

lifestyleSection.intro:
Life in Cabo Roig moves at Mediterranean pace. The harbor is where mornings begin—coffee at a terrace watching fishermen sort their catch. The coves invite swimming in water that feels like a natural swimming pool, rock formations creating private spaces even in summer. The Saturday market is a social event as much as shopping—running into neighbors, discovering the week's freshest produce, perhaps a glass of something cold afterward.

The community here tends toward those seeking authenticity over convenience. Yes, La Zenia Boulevard is just 2 km away when you need modern shopping. But the appeal of Cabo Roig is its difference—the feeling that you've found something special that mass tourism hasn't touched.
highlights: Charming harbor with fresh seafood restaurants
Crystal-clear rocky coves—Cala Capitán, Cala Caleta
Famous Saturday market—one of the coast's best
La Zenia Boulevard just 2 km away
More upscale, quieter than neighboring areas
Strong international community with Spanish integration

amenitiesSection.beaches: Cabo Roig's beaches are different—and that's the point. Cala Capitán is the jewel: a rocky cove with crystal-clear turquoise water, natural rock pools perfect for children, and excellent snorkeling. Cala Caleta offers similar beauty with fewer crowds. For traditional sandy beach, La Zenia is just 1 km north. The coastline here rewards exploration—hidden spots, dramatic rocks, that perfect swimming hole.
amenitiesSection.dining: The harbor restaurants are legendary. Fresh fish grilled simply, arroz caldero (the local rice dish), prawns that were swimming this morning—this is Spanish coastal cooking at its finest. Prices are reasonable, views are included. The commercial strip along the main road offers everything from British pubs to Italian trattorias. For variety, La Zenia Boulevard's 30+ restaurants are 5 minutes away.
amenitiesSection.shopping: Cabo Roig has traditional shops, supermarkets, and pharmacies for daily needs. But the real shopping experience is the Saturday market—hundreds of stalls, fresh produce, fish, flowers, clothing, housewares, and the indefinable treasures that make markets special. For major shopping, La Zenia Boulevard (2 km) has 150+ stores including all major brands.
amenitiesSection.healthcare: Hospital Universitario de Torrevieja is 10 km away (12 minutes), with comprehensive services and English-speaking staff. Several private clinics, dentists, and 24-hour pharmacies serve the area. Many healthcare providers are accustomed to international patients given the expat population.
amenitiesSection.transport: Alicante-Elche Airport is 52 km away (38 minutes via AP-7). Murcia-Corvera Airport is 35 km (28 minutes). A car is recommended for maximum convenience, though the area is walkable for daily needs. Coastal buses connect to Torrevieja and other towns. Taxis are readily available.

neighborhoods.name: Harbor Area (Puerto)
neighborhoods.description: Premium location overlooking the harbor. Walking distance to restaurants and coves. Highest prices but unbeatable location. Mostly apartments and townhouses.

neighborhoods.name: Cala Capitán
neighborhoods.description: Properties near the famous cove. Mix of established villas and newer developments. Sea views available from elevated positions.

neighborhoods.name: Commercial Strip
neighborhoods.description: Along the main road. Good access to shops and restaurants. More affordable than harbor area. Mix of property types.

neighborhoods.name: Towards La Zenia
neighborhoods.description: Northern edge, convenient for both Cabo Roig character and La Zenia Boulevard. Newer developments with modern specifications.

content.propertyMarketSection:
Cabo Roig commands a slight premium over neighboring areas, reflecting its character and desirability. New build apartments start from around €210,000-380,000, townhouses from €280,000-480,000, and villas from €450,000-850,000. Harbor-view and cove-proximity properties are particularly sought after.

The rental market is strong with a slightly different profile than La Zenia. Cabo Roig attracts couples, golf groups, and those seeking authentic Mediterranean experience over shopping convenience. Rentals tend toward longer stays with higher per-night rates. Premium properties near the harbor achieve excellent yields.

Resale properties often offer larger plots and established gardens. Some of the most desirable properties in Orihuela Costa are older villas in Cabo Roig with character that new builds can't replicate.
whyLiveHereSection: Crystal-clear rocky beaches unlike anywhere else
Famous Saturday market at your doorstep
Fresh seafood dining at the harbor
La Zenia Boulevard convenience just 2 km away
Strong property values due to limited supply

faqs.question: Vad gör Cabo Roig annorlunda från La Zenia?
faqs.answer: Cabo Roig har mer traditionell medelhavskaraktär med sin charmiga hamn, steniga vikar och berömda lördagsmarknad. La Zenia är mer modern och kommersiell, centrerad på Boulevard shoppingcenter och sandstrand. Cabo Roig är något mer upmarked och lugn. De är intilliggande, så du kan njuta av båda.

faqs.question: Vad är Cabo Roig-lördagsmarknaden?
faqs.answer: En av de bästa marknaderna på Costa Blanca—hundratals stånd som säljer färsk produce, fisk, blommor, kläder, hantverk och hushållsartiklar. Den drivs varje lördag från 8:00 till 14:00 och lockar besökare från helt regionen. Det är lika mycket en social händelse som shopping.

faqs.question: Är Cabo Roig bra för strander?
faqs.answer: Ja, men annorlunda från typiska spanska strander. Cala Capitán och Cala Caleta är steniga vikar med kristallklart vatten, naturliga steninpassningar och utmärkt snorkling. Om du föredrar sandstrander är La Zenia Beach bara 1 km norr. De steniga vikarna är Cabo Roigs unika försäljningspunkt.

faqs.question: Vilka är fastighetspriser i Cabo Roig?
faqs.answer: Cabo Roig kräver små premier över grannskapsområden. Lägenheter börjar från €210 000, radhus från €280 000 och villor från €450 000. Hamn-vypeegenskaper är särskilt eftertraktade. Totalt priser är 10-15% högre än motsvarande La Zenia-fastigheter.

faqs.question: Hur långt är Cabo Roig från golfbanor?
faqs.answer: Cabo Roig har utmärkt golfåtkomst: Campoamor Golf (3 km), Villamartin (4 km), Las Ramblas (5 km) och Las Colinas (10 km). Alla ligger inom 12 minuters körning. Området lockar golfspelare som söker medelhavskaraktär tillsammans med sitt spel.

faqs.question: Är Cabo Roig bra för hyresinvestering?
faqs.answer: Ja, med en annan profil än mass-marknads områden. Cabo Roig lockar par, golfspelare och dem som söker autentisk medelhavsupplevelse. Uthyrningar tenderar mot längre vistelser till premium priser. Hamn-vype och vik-närhet-fastigheter fungerar särskilt bra.

faqs.question: Hur är matscenen i Cabo Roig?
faqs.answer: Hamn restaurangerna är legendariska för färsk skaldjur—grillad fisk, paella, räkor som fångades denna morgon. Huvudremsan erbjuder internationella alternativ. Det är allmänt ansett som de bästa skaldjurs-maten på Orihuela Costa. Reservationer rekommenderas under högsäsong.

faqs.question: Talas engelska omfattande i Cabo Roig?
faqs.answer: Ja, engelska talar omfattande på grund av den internationella communityn. De flesta restauranger, butiker och tjänster vänder sig till engelsktalare. Communityn har betydande skandinavisk närvaro tillsammans med brittiska invånare. Spansk integration är lättare här än på vissa områden.

faqs.question: Hur långt är La Zenia Boulevard från Cabo Roig?
faqs.answer: La Zenia Boulevard ligger bara 2 km från Cabo Roig—omkring 5 minuters körning eller en 20-minuters gång. Du får den traditionella karaktären i Cabo Roig med shoppingbekvämlighetens comfort nära. Det bästa av båda världarna.

faqs.question: Är Cabo Roig lämpligt för familjer?
faqs.answer: Ja, särskilt familjer som uppskattar autentisk medelhavskaraktär. Sten-puljerna vid Cala Capitán är perfekta för barn, communityn är säker och La Zenias faciliteter ligger nära. Det är lugn där än La Zenia, vilket vissa familjer föredrar.

content.conclusion:
Cabo Roig erbjuder något alltmer sällsynt på Costa Blanca: genuin medelhavskaraktär som inte har gått vilse till utveckling. Hamnen, vikarna, lördagsmarknaden—dessa är inte tillverkade attraktioner utan autentiska delar av kustliv. För köpare som söker kvalitet över kvantitet, karaktär framför bekvämlighet, belönar Cabo Roig rikt.

Ready att utforska fastigheter i Cabo Roig? Vårt lag specialiserar sig på detta särskilt område, förstår vad som gör det speciellt och vem det passar bäst. Oavsett om du söker en hamn-vypelägenhet, en villa nära vikarna eller en investering i kvalitet, vägleder vi dig genom varje steg.

investmentAnalysis.rentalYield: 5-7% on quality apartments, 6-8% on harbor-view properties
investmentAnalysis.annualAppreciation: 3-4% annually, steady growth from character premium and limited supply
investmentAnalysis.overview: Cabo Roig's rental market attracts quality-focused visitors and golfers willing to pay premium nightly rates. The limited supply of harbor properties and rocky coves creates sustained demand. Character premium justifies prices higher than equivalent La Zenia properties.
highlights: Harbor-view apartments command premium rental rates
Couples and golf groups seeking authentic experience drive strong bookings
Saturday market and restaurant scene creates tourist attraction value
Limited supply of quality properties maintains price strength
Longer average stays at premium rates than mass-market areas

costOfLiving.intro: Cabo Roig's cost of living reflects its more upmarket positioning compared to neighboring areas. Daily expenses are higher than inland towns but comparable to other coastal resort communities.

items.notes: Harbor-view significantly more; commercial strip less expensive
Air conditioning essential in summer, increases seasonal bills
Higher than inland; tourist season affects availability and prices
Harbor seafood restaurants more expensive than average
Beachfront and harbor locations command premium prices
Private insurance recommended for faster specialist access
IBI for typical coastal apartment or villa
Fresh produce and household items add to weekly shopping

events.intro: Cabo Roig's event calendar balances traditional Spanish fiestas with events celebrating its maritime heritage. The Saturday market is arguably the biggest regular attraction.

events.name: Saturday Market (Mercado de los Sábados)
events.description: One of Costa Blanca's largest and most famous markets, stretching along Calle de la Cigüeña with hundreds of stalls, fresh produce, fish, flowers, and crafts

events.name: Fiestas Patronales (Patron Saint Fiesta)
events.description: Orihuela Costa-wide celebration with parades, live music, food stalls, and harbor celebrations specific to Cabo Roig

events.name: Fiesta del Mar (Sea Festival)
events.description: Maritime-focused celebration with beach activities, boat races, and seafood competitions highlighting Cabo Roig's harbor heritage

events.name: Semana Santa (Holy Week)
events.description: Religious processions through the harbor area with traditional Spanish ceremonies

events.name: Christmas Markets at the Harbor
events.description: Festive season markets and decorations around the harbor, special holiday dining at restaurants

events.name: New Year's Eve Celebrations
events.description: Harbor parties, fireworks over the water, and traditional Spanish 12-grape celebration

schools.intro: Cabo Roig itself has limited school options, with most families using nearby Orihuela Costa schools or international alternatives in La Zenia and Torrevieja.

schools.name: Colegio Público Orihuela Costa
schools.description: Spanish public school serving the Orihuela Costa area with bilingual education programs

schools.name: International Schools (La Zenia)
schools.description: British and other international curriculum schools near La Zenia Boulevard for expat families

schools.name: Colegio Privado (Private Schools)
schools.description: Various private school options with English-language instruction and Spanish curriculum alternatives

natureActivities.intro: Cabo Roig's natural attractions center on its distinctive rocky coastline, clear Mediterranean waters, and marine activities. The focus is water-based rather than inland nature.

activities.name: Snorkeling at Cala Capitán
activities.description: Crystal-clear rocky cove with abundant marine life, excellent visibility, and natural rock formations perfect for exploration

activities.name: Swimming in Cala Caleta
activities.description: Smaller, quieter cove with similar water clarity, ideal for families and those seeking peaceful swimming

activities.name: Coastal walking paths
activities.description: Scenic trails along cliffs overlooking the Mediterranean, connecting different coves and viewpoints

activities.name: Sailing and boat trips
activities.description: Harbor-based sailing experiences, fishing trips, or boat excursions along the Costa Blanca coast

activities.name: Fishing from the rocks
activities.description: Traditional Spanish fishing from rocky outcrops, popular for both sport and sustenance fishing

activities.name: Sunset viewing from harbor
activities.description: Spectacular Mediterranean sunsets over the harbor, best experienced from waterfront terraces

expatCommunity.intro: Cabo Roig has a well-established, sophisticated expatriate community that leans toward quality-conscious buyers. The international population is significant but integrated with Spanish culture.
highlights: Sophisticated expat community focused on quality of life
Strong British presence alongside Scandinavian, German, and other Europeans
Integration with Spanish culture valued alongside expat social infrastructure
Golf clubs and yacht clubs provide natural community gathering points
Less transient than mass-market resorts—many long-term residents and permanent settlers

lifestyleTimeline.title: A Typical Day in Cabo Roig

entries.description: Start the day with a walk along the harbor watching fishing boats, stopping for café con leche at a waterfront bar
Shop the famous market for fresh produce, fish, flowers, and discover treasures among the hundreds of stalls
Main meal featuring fresh grilled fish, arroz caldero, or seafood paella overlooking the water
Afternoon rest or swimming in one of the rocky coves with crystal-clear water
Round at Villamartin (4 km), Las Ramblas (5 km), or Campoamor (3 km) golf courses
Evening stroll through town, greeting friends, drinks at a favorite bar
Evening meal (lighter than lunch), often at the harbor for sunset views and fresh seafood

schema.name: Cabo Roig
schema.description: Cabo Roig is a characterful coastal village in Orihuela Costa, Costa Blanca South, known for its charming harbor, crystal-clear rocky coves (Cala Capitán), famous Saturday market, and fresh seafood restaurants.

mainEntity.name: What makes Cabo Roig different from La Zenia?

acceptedAnswer.text: Cabo Roig has more traditional Mediterranean character with its charming harbor, rocky coves, and famous Saturday market. La Zenia is more modern and commercial. Cabo Roig is slightly more upscale and quieter.

mainEntity.name: What is the Cabo Roig Saturday Market?

acceptedAnswer.text: One of the best markets on Costa Blanca—hundreds of stalls selling fresh produce, fish, flowers, clothing, and crafts. Every Saturday 8 AM to 2 PM.

mainEntity.name: What are property prices in Cabo Roig?

acceptedAnswer.text: Apartments start from €210,000, townhouses from €280,000, and villas from €450,000. Prices are 10-15% higher than equivalent La Zenia properties due to character and demand.

mainEntity.name: Is Cabo Roig good for beaches?

acceptedAnswer.text: Cabo Roig has unique rocky coves (Cala Capitán, Cala Caleta) with crystal-clear water and natural rock pools. Sandy La Zenia Beach is just 1 km away.

mainEntity.name: How far is Cabo Roig from golf courses?

acceptedAnswer.text: Excellent access: Campoamor Golf (3 km), Villamartin (4 km), Las Ramblas (5 km), Las Colinas (10 km). All within 12 minutes drive.
